column2: NEVADA DMV PERMIT TEST
column4: Nevada
column6: NV

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. It is important for drivers to know that trucks:
column4: take longer than cars to stop.
column6: require less time to pass on an incline than cars.
column8: are easier for the driver to operate.
column10: require more space for turning movements.

column2: 2. The yield sign means:
column4: Stop.
column6: Go. The light will soon be red.
column8: If the way is clear, you may move forward slowly without stopping.

column2: 3. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column4: avoid drinking coffee.
column6: turn on the radio to keep you awake.
column8: find a safe place to stop for a break.
column10: have a beer or two to keep you awake.

column2: 4. A vehicle that enters a road from a driveway:
column4: must stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic on the roadway and to pedestrians.
column6: must yield to traffic approaching from the right, while it has the right-of-way over vehicles approaching from the left.
column8: must enter the roadway immediately.

column2: 5. When you see this sign you should:
column4: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.
column6: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.
column8: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.
column10: prepare to slow down and possibly yield to oncoming traffic.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column4: Low shoulder
column6: Stop sign ahead
column8: Keep to the side indicated by the arrow

column2: 7. Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
column4: wait until the crossing gates are completely up.
column6: look and listen for trains.
column8: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.

column2: 8. When passing another vehicle, before turning back into the right-hand lane drivers should wait until they can see the vehicle they are passing in the rearview mirror.
column4: False
column6: True

column2: 9. When driving on slick roads, drivers should:
column4: take turns more slowly.
column6: use alternate routes.
column8: drive as they would on dry roads.

column2: 10. Who has a greater risk of being involved in a traffic crash?
column4: Shift workers.
column6: Drivers who are driving alone.
column8: Young people.

column2: 11. At a stop sign there is no stop line, you must stop:
column4: before you enter the intersection.
column6: before the traffic light turns red.
column8: before you enter the crosswalk.

column2: 12. When changing lanes, you should not:
column4: check your side and rear view mirrors.
column6: use the inside rearview mirror to check for blind spots
column8: check to see if other drivers are moving into the same lane.

column2: 13. If you are continually being passed on the right, you should:
column4: pull over to the right and stop until the road is clear.
column6: increase your speed immediately.
column8: move into the left lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the right.
column10: move into the right lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the left.

column2: 14. If you missed your exit on a freeway, you should:
column4: None of the above.
column6: use the right turn signal, check your mirrors and move to the right.
column8: make a quick U-turn from your lane of travel.
column10: go to the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.

column2: 15. When driving in travel lanes on the roadway:
column4: you may make a U-turn if you get on the wrong entrance ramp of the freeway.
column6: do not stop for any reason, keep moving until you can safely pull off the road.
column8: you may make back up quickly if there are no vehicles behind.
column10: you may stop to let out passengers.

column2: 16. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a winding road ahead.
column6: there's an intersection ahead.
column8: there is a double curve ahead.
column10: they must turn either to the right or left.

column2: 17. If you drink alcohol socially, what helps insure safe driving?
column4: Drink coffee before driving.
column6: Ride home with a friend who has not been drinking.
column8: Stop drinking one hour before driving.
column10: Take a cold shower before driving.

column2: 18. Braking distance is affected by:
column4: the condition of your brakes and tires.
column6: the speed your vehicle is traveling.
column8: pavement conditions.

column2: 19. A traffic light shows both a red light and a green arrow. The driver may not turn in the direction of the arrow until the red light has changed.
column4: False
column6: True

column2: 20. When you drive near parks and playgrounds, you should expect children:
column4: not to cross unless they are with an adult.
column6: to stop at the curb before crossing the street.
column8: to know when it is safe to cross.
column10: to suddenly run into the street.

column2: 21. The yield sign means:
column4: You must come to a complete stop.
column6: Drive with caution in wet weather.
column8: Slow down and give vehicles crossing your path the right-of-way.
column10: The traffic light will soon be red.

column2: 22. Alcohol:
column4: makes it difficult for drivers to judge their condition.
column6: increases reaction time.
column8: makes drivers more prone to take chances.

column2: 23. When driving in fog, drivers should:
column4: slow down and drive cautiously.
column6: use low beam headlights to better illuminate the road ahead.
column8: not use high beam headlights.

column2: 24. After you stop for a school bus, you must:
column4: wait until the red lights stop flashing.
column6: pass the bus before the red lights stop flashing.
column8: turn off your engine.

column2: 25. What should you do if your brakes fail?
column4: Hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it.
column6: Turn on your cruise control.
column8: Pull the steering wheel back.
column10: Try pumping the brake pedal to increase pressure.

column2: 26. This road sign means:
column4: No U-turn
column6: Winding road ahead
column8: Sharp curve ahead

column2: 27. This sign means:
column4: the road may be slippery when wet.
column6: no turns are allowed on this road.
column8: narrow road ahead.

column2: 28. This sign is a:
column4: warning sign.
column6: guide sign.
column8: regulatory sign.

column2: 29. A flashing yellow traffic signal means:
column4: Stop and proceed when a green light appears.
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.
column8: Slow down and be alert at the upcoming intersection.

column2: 30. When a driver is turning and a pedestrian is crossing without a traffic light, __________ must yield the right-of-way.
column4: the driver
column6: both
column8: the pedestrian

column2: 31. When approaching a curve, remember to:
column4: slow down before entering the curve.
column6: accelerate slightly before entering the curve.
column8: drive at the posted speed limit as you enter the curve, then slow down gradually.
column10: drive at the posted speed limit throughout the curve.

column2: 32. Drivers should treat a railroad crossbuck sign the same as a yield sign.
column4: True
column6: False

column2: 33. This road sign means:
column4: No Bicycle zone
column6: Bicycles have the right-of-way
column8: Watch for bicycles

column2: 34. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column4: you can reduce fuel consumption.
column6: you increase the chance of a crash.
column8: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.

column2: 35. Where are yield signs usually placed?
column4: Where major roads lead into  auxiliary roads.
column6: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.
column8: Where auxiliary roads lead into major roads.

column2: 36. To avoid being in a truck driver’s blind spot, you should:
column4: sound your horn.
column6: avoid driving on either side of the truck and don’t tailgate.
column8: never pass the truck and put your headlights on.

column2: 37. This road sign means:
column4: Divided highway ends
column6: Keep right
column8: Keep right, traffic is entering from another road.

column2: 38. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.
column6: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.
column8: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.

column2: 39. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column4: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.
column6: cross the tracks.
column8: get back into the vehicle.

column2: 40. A driver approaching a flashing red traffic signal must:
column4: slow down at the traffic signal.
column6: stop before the intersection.
column8: carefully drive through the intersection without stopping.

column2: 41. A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means:
column4: Passing is permitted on the side of the solid yellow line
column6: Passing is permitted on the side of the broken yellow line
column8: Passing is not permitted in either direction
column10: Passing on the right is permitted in either direction

column2: 42. If you see a “lane closed ahead” sign you should:
column4: merge into the correct lane when it is safe.
column6: speed to the end of the closed lane and try to get into the other lane.
column8: make a U-turn. You are on the wrong side of the road.

column2: 43. A merge sign means drivers should be prepared to change lanes or allow other traffic to come into their lane.
column4: False
column6: True

column2: 44. This road sign means:
column4: Crossroad ahead
column6: You must turn right
column8: Railroad crossing

column2: 45. This road sign means:
column4: Left turns are permitted
column6: No U-turns
column8: No right turn
column10: You may turn right after yielding the right-of-way to oncoming traffic

column2: 46. This sign means:
column4: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column6: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.
column8: Double curve ahead.
column10: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 47. What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
column4: Decrease pressure on the brake pedal if your wheels begin to lock.
column6: Brake early and gently.
column8: Allow the wheels to keep turning.

column2: 48. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road ahead is narrow.
column6: there is a one lane bridge ahead.
column8: drivers in the left lane have the right-of-way

column2: 49. An octagonal sign means that drivers must:
column4: respect the posted speed limit.
column6: slow down.
column8: be aware possible hazards ahead.
column10: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 50. This road sign means:
column4: Yield to motorcyles, but not to bicycles
column6: Bicycles cross or ride beside traffic
column8: Bicycles have the same rights as other vehicles
